title: Bug 102436: Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: Bug 102436: Date/time value not stored correctly in report design. An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB: When a 'DateTime' type report parameter is created in BIRT report designer and an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999', is entered in the 'defaultValue' field, the system does not reject the input.
EB: The system should reject the input of an invalid date string in the 'defaultValue' field of a 'DateTime' type report parameter in BIRT report designer.
SR:
1. Open BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report parameter of type 'DateTime'.
3. In the 'defaultValue' field of the parameter, enter an invalid date string, like '55/66/9999'.
4. Save and apply the changes.
5. Check if the system rejects the invalid date string input and displays an appropriate error message.
